channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump’s ‘punitive’ China tariffs could end trade between the world’s two largest economies—and that would be painful, volatile, and dangerous
item.description: Can U.S.-China trade survive in a post-145% tariff world?

item.title: Trump is on a Path to Failure
item.description: The fact that Trump survived bad trajectories before doesn’t mean that this one is destined to reverse.

item.title: Trump Adds Tariff Exemptions for Smartphones, Computers and Other Electronics
item.description: A long list of electronic products got a reprieve for now from at least some of the levies on China, which had been expected to take a toll on tech gi...

item.title: Trump and Some of His Cabinet Members Attend U.F.C. Fight in Miami
item.description: The spectacle at the mixed martial arts event was emblematic of an emboldened president who increasingly encourages displays of force to carry out his...

item.title: Harvard professors sue Trump over threat to $9 billion in funds
item.description: The administration’s review of Harvard includes $8.7 billion in grants and $225.6 million in contracts.

item.title: How Brexit, a Startling Act of Economic Self-Harm, Foreshadowed Trump’s Tariffs
item.description: Britain’s decision to leave the European Union in 2016 was sold to voters as a magic bullet that would revitalize the country’s economy. Its impact is...

item.title: How Brexit, a Startling Act of Economic Self-Harm, Foreshadowed Trump’s Tariffs
item.description: Britain’s decision to leave the European Union in 2016 was sold to voters as a magic bullet that would revitalize the country’s economy. Its impact is...

item.title: Manchester Arena Bomber’s Brother Is Accused of Attack on Prison Guards
item.description: Hashem Abedi allegedly stabbed the officers with homemade weapons inside a high-security prison.

item.title: For Taiwan’s Small Exporters, the Uncertainty’s as Bad as the Tariffs
item.description: The island’s many small factories have thrived by being frugal — and flexible. But President Trump’s unpredictability is testing their limits.

item.title: Germany’s Merz says Trump tariffs risk fanning a financial crisis
item.description: “President Trump’s policies are increasing the risk that the next financial crisis will hit sooner than expected,” Merz told Handelsblatt.

item.title: Trump can pull stocks back from the brink, but bond and currency markets may not be so easily impressed as they rapidly de-dollarize
item.description: "The fact that the dollar is going down at the same time, I think, lends some more credibility to the story of investor preferences shifting."

item.title: In One Colorado Town, People Experiencing Homelessness Can Sleep in Their Car — if They Have a Job
item.description: People experiencing homelessness can sleep in their cars in this wealthy ski town in Colorado, but only if they have a job.

item.title: US won’t say whether it’s facilitating return of mistakenly deported man, despite judge’s order
item.description: The Trump administration confirmed to a federal judge Saturday that a Maryland man who was mistakenly deported remains confined in El Salvador.

item.title: Sudan Clinic Workers Killed in Zamzam Camp
item.description: Relief International said nine employees were killed when gunmen stormed the Zamzam camp in El Fasher, in the western Darfur region.

item.title: Hostages Still Held in Gaza Cast Shadow Over Passover in Israel
item.description: The holiday is usually a celebration of the liberation of ancient Israelites from slavery in Egypt. But for many Israelis, the suffering of the captiv...
